page.title: 03Express Dairy U.K. Ltd.cont.
page.content: However,during the war,paraffin wax containers were no longer available and so cartoning stopped.In 1941 the factory was acquired by Independant Milk Supplies and was soon specialising in cheddar cheese production.About 40,000lbs of cheese was produced each day together with some whey butter. The Express Dairy Company took over the factory in 1959 and continued to produce cheese until 1975.That year the Salad Production Department at Ruislip was transferred to Milborne and cheese production ended.However,milk is still handled at Milborne.It is collected each day from 126 farms and sent by tanker to London for bottling.
